Does temporary dexterity counts as dexterity for the sake of this card?

so <ancient power> would work

messages.content: dexterity is good, this gives mostly good dexterity cards. Its always a reliable pick; as theres only 15 cards this can pull. The good ones are, footwork, wraith form, reprogram, grow, iron fortress, good clean fight, burning question and maintence. Theres reckless strike and ancient power, which are okay. Then the bad ones are, evasive protocol, its a feature, fortify and fasting.
What are you on about with fasting
snecko can easily muddle stuff to 0
It adds up to 9/15 cards are good, with 2 decent ones (cards that are at least not dead) with only 4 truly bad ones (out of those 4, fasting can be usable sometimes at least)

https://slay.ocean.lol/search?in%3Ddexterity%20mod%3Ddownfall%20mod%3Dslaythespire%20type%3Dcard
(emerald doesnt count)

messages.content: You still never want to lose an energy per turn. it doesnt do well compared to the more consistent cards
compared to a card like reprogram or burning question, which snecko can upgrade and play like 3 times in a turn for effectively no downside; o
Did someone say <Wraith Form>?

embeds.title: Wraith Form
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 3 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Gain 2 (3) **Intangible** :p_intangible:.
At the end of your turn, lose 1 **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: as much as it's helpful to have a really small card pool for this unidentified, I think it shouldn't exist
doesn't really fit the spirit of unidentified cards
I have to agree
what could you do about this though? Ironclad doesnt have any dex cards and adding too many dexterity cards to the boss characters could easily cause a new problem
remove this from the pool

well evab already said their solution
axe it
I think unidentifieds have problems anyway and need a full re-evaluation
Snecko sorta needs unid dex and unid block though
the character would be far to reliant on mud shield without reliable sources of block

that highlights one of the problems with unidentified cards in the first place; the unidentifieds create categories that don't matter very much, so the few that do becomes snecko's most necessary unidentified cards
whats wrong with this though?
you're not actually building a deck, you're taking cards that might be strong and hoping they work out
no matter who you're playing, you always need to build block cards at some point, and yet snecko only has one unidentified block card available to them
likewise, snecko only has three unidentified Attack cards
this is one of the big reasons that snecko struggles in the early game
you still end up building a real deck out of the cards you identity though (its very rare for an a20 snecko to win without using offclass)

even if you end up with a real deck after identifying, before identifying, sneckos unidentified cards are of very strict power levels that make certain cards almost always better to take than other ones
the entire characters theme is dealing with the cards your given in any run; you still end up using the weaker (and even the worst) cards in full runs
its dexterity
dexterity good
i close my case your honor
for ??? dex you cannot really say "i'm going to get reprogram and exotic form every single run" Because thats not going to happen; but you can adapt with the other cards in the ??? dex pool
having a mostly good pool of cards to pick from makes the card more interactive rather then one you rarely draft (like ??? X cost)
the whole problem with the dexterity card is that there are so few cards in the pool in the first place, so what is there even to adapt to?

and you even mentioned how important it is for Dex unidentified to be in the pool because snecko needs block, so if "you need ??? Dex so make sure you take one" is the right play, where is the deckbuilding decision? You just have a powerful card in snecko's pool that's taken almost every run no matter what you get from it
I think thats more of an issue with to many other ??? cards being to swingy
I am personally viewing the character from the context on how it does with pure snecko. I can imagine that ??? dex would be even stronger for normal snecko
yes it would be
on normal snecko you can force a specific dex card easily

I am someone who heavily dislikes using Snecko (normal OR pure) and have been wanting the "needed" stuff to be relegated to regular Snecko cards. I think the unidentified cards aren't fun. You want to try to get neat combinations? That's fine. Good luck getting that when most of the unidentified cards are so annoying to see in the card rewards.

Also, if Snecko NEEDS Unidentified Dex and Unidentified Block, then where's the choice in deckbuilding? How is it fun to play a character that requires one of two specific cards to have any sort of defense? That seems like an issue to me.

unid dex and  block have the choices built in. Theres also transforms that can give you block mid combat, although those are less reliable. I do think snecko needs more block in your normal card pool though

ironclad = X
silent = footwork, wraith form
defect = reprogram
watcher = fasting
hermit = maintenance
slime boss = grow
guardian = ancient power, evasive protocol
hexaghost = burning question
champ = endure, good clean fight, iron fortress, reckless strike
gremlins = X
automaton = fortify, its a feature
in general sneckos normal card pool is pretty small and theres a lot of overlap
like theres 2 cards that muddle your whole hand, with one having the small buff of not making the cards cost 3.

and then theres a card that gives you the card that muddles your whole hand every turn; thats 3 cards giving the exact same effect with only minor variations (in practice they are all used the same way)
this is like too small of a pool to have this card exist
also consider that the ??? cards will expand when we get more bosses
so ??? dex should have like 20 or more cards eventually; if not more (if one of the bosses ends up having dexterity being a greater focus)
thats the case in true snecko mode
but you have a high chance of having like 3 or less cards in the pool
~~all of the more reason to make pure snecko the default ~~

That's not a choice, though. Again, if you NEED Unidentified Dex and Unidentified Block to have a semblance of any sort of defense, then there's no choice in the card rewards. You HAVE to have them, or you will likely die. Pure Snecko or Draft Choice Snecko. To me, that's not fun. That's not choice.

but there is choice, how much block you need will vary every run. Choosing what to ID is the main decision making on snecko anyways. I said snecko needs the cards but you can still win without them; they are just nice to have (mostly for late game where you want some sort of way to generate block for the 3 last bosses)
like I had this funny picture where I used nightmare with roundhose kick and vault as my "block"
mud shield spam is your most common block method without considering offclass (which is unfortunate since mud shield is rare)

ah yes, the only natural successor to the runic dome strategy
"who cares what the enemy does? the enemy now does **nothing**"
I mean there's just like sneckos block cards like dice block improvised guard and <gain block for each unidentified>

For each Ignited Ghostflame, **Upgrade** a random card in your hand.

footer.text: <gain block for each unidentified> = stoke the fire, 34% sure

messages.content: Those block cards have decent numbers (except dice block) and are very essential to blocking aswell as they are in the base kit
"gain block for each unidentified"?
u mean gain block for each offclass?
Yeah
<gain block from offclass>

messages.content: <defensive flair>

embeds.title: Defensive Flair
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_snek: / The Snecko / Downfall

Gain 8 (10) **Block** :p_block:, increased by 1 (2) for each **Offclass** card in your hand.

messages.content: Funny card xddddx
Probably more than any other card exposes how limited snecko pool can be
This usually works out to your advantage though. And as pointed out, Wraith form is nearly always gonna be the best thing you can get from this
Maybe that makes silent good as a general choice for snecko, since wraith form at uncommon is sort of crazy
Snecko does need to basically upgrade this twice though, but they can more easily make it cost less with muddle
Evasive protocol isn't horrible since it activates brace, but you'll most likely already have a card that does
